Rajat Shinde
About Me

About Me

I am a Masters-PhD (Dual Degree) Student in Geo-informatics and a Prime Minister's Research Fellow (2018) working under the supervision of Prof. Surya S Durbha at the Geocomputational Systems and IoT Group in Centre of Studies in Resources Engineering , IIT Bombay. I have completed my undergraduation in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from National Institute of Technology Raipur in 2016.

I love to play flute and save shots on a goal post while playing football.

My research interests lies at the intersection of 3D computer vision, machine learning, embedded systems, Internet of Things, high performance computing and signal processing. My Masters-PhD topic involves application of Machine Learning for onboard point cloud processing.

Research

  • Compressive Sensing Based Reconstruction And Pixel-Level Classification of VHR Disaster Satellite Imagery Using Deep Learning
    Rajat Shinde, Abhishek Potnis, Surya Durbha, Prakash Andugula
    Paper Accepted in IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS 2019), Japan
  • Multi-class Segmentation of Urban Floods From Multispectral Imagery Using Deep Learning
    Abhishek Potnis, Rajat Shinde, Surya Durbha, Kuldeep Kurte
    Paper Accepted in IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS 2019), Japan
  • Rapid Earthquake Damage Detection Using Deep Learning From VHR Remote Sensing Images
    Ujwala Bhangale, Surya Durbha, Abhishek Potnis, Rajat Shinde
    Paper Accepted in IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS 2019), Japan
  • Semantic Framework For Spatial Query Reformulation For Disaster Monitoring Applications
    Kuldeep Kurte, Abhishek Potnis, Surya Durbha, Rajat Shinde
    Paper Accepted in IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS 2019), Japan
  • Information Table based Decision Approach for Broadcast Storm Suppression in Vehicular Ad-Hoc Networks
    Aditya Om, Rajat Shinde, Sejal Agrawal, A.S. Raghuvanshi
    International Journal of Engineering and Technical Research V5(04), April 2016
    DOI: 10.17577/IJERTV5IS040769

Projects

  • Earth Engine India Advanced Summit Buildathon 2019
    Worked on "Locating Solar Farms in Selected Sites of India using Google Earth Engine"
    • In a team of 6, implemented random-forest classifier to solve binary classification problem (Solar Farm: 1, Non-Solar farm: 0) with an accuracy of 81%
    • Added Wavelet Kernel-based convolution approach for solar panels texture detection thus improving the accuracy to 83.6%

      • Presentation | Code

  • Earthquake Prediction Using Machine Learning Techniques
    • In a team of 4, implemented machine learning models(SVM, ANN, Random Forests & Decision Tree Classifier) obtaining maximum accuracy of 94.5% to predict the earthquake in the Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Sumatra region
    • Extracted features (b-values) from USGS earthquake dataset of the last 26 years to train models

      • Report

  • Image Pre-processing using Lee & Gradient-Inverse Kernels
    • Implemented Lee kernel and Gradient-Inverse kernel for satellite image pre-processing
    • Developed a Graphical User Interface (GUI) based application in MATLAB

      • Report | Code

Open Source Contributions

  • OSGeo India - Charter Member

  • Google Summer of Code 2018 Mentor for MapMint under OSGeo organization

  • Google Summer of Code 2017 Student for MapMint under OSGeo organization

    • Added Audio and Video data recording capability to the MapMint4ME Android application
    • Added Sensor data recording capability to the MapMint4ME Android application for remote data acquisition

    Project | Wiki | Certificate of Completion
